benchmark_details.name: Saturation-Driven Dataset Generation for LLM
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a new framework for generating tasks for mathematical reasoning in LLMs, utilizing a saturation-driven approach to ensure logical validity of generated problems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To generate a diverse set of logically valid reasoning tasks to assess and improve the reasoning capabilities of LLMs.

data.source: TPTP axiom library used to generate theorems through saturation.
data.annotation: Automatically generated through a reasoning framework.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of correctly identified tasks and logical entailments.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better reasoning capabilities of LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance of gpt-5 models evaluated across various tasks.
methodology.validation: Tasks validated using advanced theorem provers like Vampire.
